title: TIPS TO MAKE IT WORK BEST FOR YOUR FOUNDATION PHASE
description: When working on form, structure, and sense, practice outlining passages briefly to capture the authorâ€™s intent and paragraph purpose quickly. This will help you trust your initial understanding and reduce overanalysis during timed practice.

For rhetorical synthesis, focus on creating clear connections between sources using transitional phrases. After practice, journal moments when your synthesis felt confident and accurate to reinforce trusting your integrative instincts.

In mastering transitions, challenge yourself with timed sentence-combining exercises that require selecting the most logical transition. This will build your ability to make swift, purposeful choices without sacrificing clarity.

When studying nonlinear functions, sketch graphs before solving problems to deepen conceptual understanding. Use timed drills to practice recognizing function types quickly, helping you balance thoroughness with efficient decision-making.

For linear functions, regularly translate word problems into equations under timed conditions. This will train you to commit to answers confidently and improve your speed in interpreting slopes and intercepts.

With systems of linear equations, practice setting up and solving problems step-by-step, then review solutions immediately to confirm accuracy. This reflection will build confidence in your problem-solving process and reduce hesitation.
